page.title: 09HEDGE SURVEY AT NANTGLYN 1
page.content:
This survey was done by the top class at Nantglyn Junior School. The hedge studied has been part of the landscape for many years.Its 66m. length formed the boundary between a narrow road and the school playing field. The species of tree observed in the hedge were {sycamore(most common) {blackthorn hazel hawthorn oak {wild rose elder ivy. } The age of the hedge was estimated using the formula of Dr.Max Hooper*. Age=(no.of species x 110) + 30years (7 x 110)+30 = 800years. This answer of {800years}seems fair since the hedge is the boundary of a road which existed at that time.
*Discovering Hedgerows.Streeter and Richardson.
